newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst -H1 97 pretax falls to 2 bln dmk.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst -H1 97 pretax falls to 2 bln dmk.

text.p: German chemical giant Hoechst AG said on Wednesday that pretax profit in the first half of 1997 fell 54 percent to two billion marks ($1.1 billion) from the previous year.
The group said, however, that year-earlier earnings had been boosted by income from disposals and that on a comparable basis Hoechst first-half pretax profit rose 10 percent.
Hoechst said in a compulsory statement that its operating profit was 2.3 billion marks, down 18 percent but up seven percent on a comparable basis. ($ = 1.865 German Marks)
The chemical group said group sales rose by seven percent to just under 28 billion marks and that foreign exchange movements contributed five percentage points to the first half sales rise.
